results.title: beta-Adrenoceptor blockade can augment the torsadogenic action of risperidone.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ alone induced @<m>DISEASE_Torsades_de_Pointes</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016171 @@@TdP@@@ in 1 out of 5 @SPECIES_9615 @@@dogs@@@; moreover, an additional infusion of @CHEMICAL_Risperidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D018967 @@@risperidone@@@ induced @<m>DISEASE_Torsades_de_Pointes</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016171 @@@TdP@@@ in 3 out of 4 @SPECIES_9615 @@@dogs@@@.

citations.NLM: Goto A, Kambayashi R, Izumi-Nakaseko H, Takei Y, Sugiyama A. beta-Adrenoceptor blockade can augment the torsadogenic action of risperidone. J Pharmacol Sci. 2024 Oct;156(2):134-141. PMID: 39179332
citations.BibTeX: @article{39179332, title={beta-Adrenoceptor blockade can augment the torsadogenic action of risperidone.}, author={Goto A and Kambayashi R and Izumi-Nakaseko H and Takei Y and Sugiyama A}, journal={J Pharmacol Sci}, volume={156}, number={2}, pages={134-141}}

results.title: The Electro-Mechanical window: a risk marker for Torsade de Pointes in a canine model of drug induced arrhythmias.
results.text_hl: However, beta-adrenoceptor stimulation (with @CHEMICAL_Isoproterenol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007545 @@@isoprenaline@@@) decreased the EMw (from 90 to 5 ms) and in combination with @CHEMICAL_HMR_1556 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C420023 @@@HMR1556@@@, a blocker of the slowly activating @CHEMICAL_Potassium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011188 @@@potassium@@@ current (I(Ks) ), induced a large negative EMw (-109ms) and @<m>DISEASE_Torsades_de_Pointes</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016171 @@@TdP.@@@ Prevention of @<m>DISEASE_Torsades_de_Pointes</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016171 @@@TdP@@@ by @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Verapamil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014700 @@@verapamil@@@ was associated with a less negative EMw (-23 to -16ms).

citations.NLM: van der Linde HJ, Van Deuren B, Somers Y, Loenders B, Towart R, Gallacher DJ. The Electro-Mechanical window: a risk marker for Torsade de Pointes in a canine model of drug induced arrhythmias. Br J Pharmacol. 2010 Dec;161(7):1444-54. PMID: 21054337
citations.BibTeX: @article{21054337, title={The Electro-Mechanical window: a risk marker for Torsade de Pointes in a canine model of drug induced arrhythmias.}, author={van der Linde HJ and Van Deuren B and Somers Y and Loenders B and Towart R and Gallacher DJ}, journal={Br J Pharmacol}, volume={161}, number={7}, pages={1444-54}}
